titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Flatlands Neck Sabbath School Society building contract and receipt 1977.163
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T16:31-0500

did.unittitle: Flatlands Neck Sabbath School Society building contract and receipt
did.abstract: This collection consists of a contract to construct a building for the Flatlands Neck Sabbath School Society in the town of Flatlands in Kings County, and a receipt from the New York Secretary of State's office indicating that the Society's certificate of incorporation has been filed. Both items date from 1868.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Flatlands Neck Sabbath School Society (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.).
